title: When isn't it a good idea for an actor or an actress to be careful in choosing their roles allowing them to become even more selective when it comes to what parts they will play? - Quora

response.answer_text: First, if the actor needs to eat and needs the money, they may have to play a role they don’t care for or be in a film or show they don’t care for. (Talking about playing Girl #3 eaten by the Alien, not pornography.) Sometimes actors, even those who can afford to be picky, should consider roles they would normally reject, because they may be limiting their growth as an actor, or may cause themselves to be pigeon-holed in one particular type of role, ultimately limiting their career. It is best for an actor to have a small number of people they trust to re-read scripts and provide their input so the actor does not throw away an opportunity due to fear or comfort-level, etc.
